meanings.definition: The quality or state of being admissible.
meanings.sent1: The admissibilities of the document were carefully reviewed by the committee.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the admissibilities of his argument during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The admissibilities of the cake to my diet were questionable, but I couldn't resist a small slice.
meanings.sent4: His admissibilities to the exclusive club were as rare as finding a diamond in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The admissibilities of the new student into the school were met with excitement and curiosity.

meanings.definition: The ability or right to be admitted or allowed.
meanings.sent1: Without the proper admissibilities, entry into the event will be denied.
meanings.sent2: She lacked the admissibilities required to access the restricted area.
meanings.sent3: His admissibilities to the party were celebrated with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent4: The admissibilities to the top university felt like winning the lottery for the young student.
meanings.sent5: The admissibilities granted to him opened doors to new opportunities and experiences.
